Class NetSocket

java.lang.Object
NetSocket
public class NetSocket extends Object
Class that handles a single connection as a listener or a broadcaster to a node

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    connect(InetAddress addr, int port)
    Sends the connection information of the host to the connected socket to allow the incoming connection
    void
    disconnect()
    Disconnect this socket by shutting down inputs and outputs, and finally closes the socket

    Disconnects and sends a disconnect message to the connected socket

    • connect

      public void connect(InetAddress addr, int port)
      Sends the connection information of the host to the connected socket to allow the incoming connection
      Parameters:
      addr - address of the host
      port - port of the host

    • readMessage

      public MessageHeader readMessage()
      Method to read a message, should only be used on connection. Other messages should be read by the protocol
      Returns:
      the MessageHeader that should represent a network connection

    • startListening

      public void startListening()
      Turn on and listen for node traffic Spawns a new thread and passes the input/output to a protocol

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(MessageHeader m)
      Sends a message to the connected socket Should not be used probably
      Parameters:
      m - MessageHeader to be sent

    • setName

      public void setName(String s)
      Set name of the socket (Listener, broadcaster)
      Parameters:
      s - name of the socket

    • pairUp

      public void pairUp(NetPair np)
      Sets the parent of this socket to the pair
      Parameters:
      np - NetPair that holds a reference to this socket
